message:
Mexico: Claudia Sheinbaum stands to be the first woman to be elected president of Mexico.

Sheinbaum, who won the elections in Mexico this morning with about 60% of the votes, is Jewish, born to parents from Lithuania and Bulgaria, a scientist, a climate expert and a member of the left political current in Mexico. She has good relations with the US and makes sure to keep the media quiet about her being Jewish.
She has spoken out against Israel in the war with Hamas.
event_breakdown: Antisemitism in Mexico: After the Israeli-Palestinian war was launched on Monday, Israeli institutions have been the target of riots in Mexico and Peru. In Mexico City, hundreds of people demonstrated in front of the Israeli embassy,   shouting slogans of “Get out of here Israel!” and “Viva Palestine!” In Mérida (in the state of Yucatán) the protesters blocked the entrance to the Israeli consulate with tires and lit them. In Mexico, in response to the violence against Jews in Mexico, which culminated in the arson and robbery of a kosher supermarket, Jews from various settlements in the country published an open letter that they posted on Facebook on Monday night, saying that they are not against the Palestinians. “We want peace for our Palestinian neighbors, who coexist and trade with us,” they stressed.
